alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 11:31PM EDT until June 02 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern New Jersey...and Pennsylvania... including the following counties...in northern New Jersey... Morris, Sussex, and Warren. In Pennsylvania...Monroe and Northampton. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1131 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Newton, Dover, Hopatcong, East Hanover, Hackettstown, Boonton, Wharton, Rockaway, Blairstown, Morris Plains, Mount Arlington, and Mountain Lakes. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 24...and between mile markers 32 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 41 and 49. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
